Questions: Express each of the following in terms of the other angular measures: (a) 28°, (b) 1/4 rev/s, (c) 2.18 rad/s².
A pendulum 90 cm long swings through a 15-cm arc. Find the angle θ in radians and degrees.
A fan turns at 900 rpm. (a) Find angular speed. (b) Find tangential speed if radius is 20 cm.
A belt over a 25 cm radius wheel moves at 5.0 m/s. How fast is the wheel turning?
A 40-cm radius wheel accelerates from rest to 900 rpm in 20 s. Find (a) angular acceleration, (b) tangential acceleration.
A pulley radius 5.0 cm turns from 30 rev/s to 20 rev/s in 2.0 s. Find (a) angular acceleration, (b) angle turned, (c) belt length wound.
solution: (a) α = −10π rad/s²; (b) θ = 100π rad; (c) l = 16 m

Questions: A 30 cm radius car wheel accelerates uniformly from rest to 15 m/s in 8.0 s. Find angular acceleration and rotations made.
A spin-drier slows from 900 rpm to 300 rpm through 50 rev. Find (a) angular acceleration, (b) time taken.
A 200-g object is whirled in a horizontal circle of radius 1.20 m at 3.0 rev/s. Find (a) acceleration, (b) tension in cord.
Find maximum speed of a car rounding a 25-m curve if static friction is 0.80.
A spaceship orbits Moon at 20,000 m height. Find (a) speed and (b) time for one orbit.
A ball tied to a 24-cm string makes 30° with vertical. Find the speed of the ball in circular path.
A 20-g bead slides from rest at A on a wire loop (h = 25 cm, R = 5 cm). Find the force exerted by wire at (a) B and (b) D.

A 0.90-kg body is whirled in a vertical circle of radius 2.50 m. (a) What is the minimum speed at the top to maintain the circular path? (b) What speed will the object have at the bottom under this condition? (c) Find the tension in the cord at the bottom.
A curve of radius 30 m is banked for a car traveling at 13 m/s without friction. What is the required banking angle?
A cylindrical shell of radius 150 cm rotates with a block inside. If μ_s = 0.30, how fast must it rotate to prevent the block from falling?
Convert (a) 50.0 rev to radians, (b) 48π rad to revolutions, (c) 72.0 rps to rad/s, (d) 1.50 × 10³ rpm to rad/s, (e) 22.0 rad/s to rpm, (f) 2.000 rad/s to deg/s.
solution: (a) 314 rad; (b) 24 rev; (c) 452 rad/s; (d) 157 rad/s; (e) 210 rev/min; (f) 114.6 deg/s

Questions: Express 40.0 deg/s in (a) rev/s, (b) rev/min, and (c) rad/s.
A flywheel turns at 480 rpm. Compute angular speed and tangential speed at 30.0 cm from center.
A grinding wheel radius 9.0 cm moves at 6.0 m/s. (a) Determine angular speed. (b) How much thread is wound in 3.0 s?
Through how many radians and at what speed does a point on Earth’s equator move in 6.00 h? Take Earth's radius = 6370 km.
A wheel 25.0 cm in radius turns from 120 rpm to 660 rpm in 9.00 s. Find (a) angular acceleration in rad/s², (b) tangential acceleration at rim.
Angular speed of disk decreases from 12.00 to 4.00 rad/s in 16.0 s. Compute angular acceleration and revolutions made.
A 30 cm radius wheel turns at 8.0 rev/s and slows to rest in 14 s. Find revolutions made and car distance.
A wheel at 6.00 rev/s has angular acceleration of 4.00 rad/s². Find (a) number of turns to 26.0 rev/s, and (b) time taken.
String on 20 cm diameter wheel is pulled at 75 cm/s. How many turns for 9.0 m unwound? How long?
1.5 kg mass moves in circle of 25 cm radius at 2.0 rev/s. Calculate (a) tangential speed, (b) acceleration, (c) centripetal force.
(a) Find radial acceleration at 60° N on Earth. (b) At pole?
Car at 5.0 m/s rounds 8.0 m radius curve. What is smallest coefficient of friction to avoid skidding?
Box on platform radius 2.0 m, μ = 0.25. What angular speed before sliding begins?
Stone in vertical circle of radius 60 cm. Find least speed to stay in contact at top.
80.0 cm pendulum bob raised 20.0 cm and released. Find speed at bottom and tension in cord.
Using Fig. 9-4, how large must h be (in terms of R) for frictionless wire to exert force at B?
In Fig. 9-4 and Prob. 9.33, if h = 2.5 R, what force does 50-g bead exert at C?
Satellite orbits Earth at 200 km height, radius 6570 km. Find (a) speed, (b) orbit time.
Coaster goes over top of hill with radius 15 m. How much higher must first hill be?
Pilot dives at 770 km/h. What minimum curvature radius to keep g-force < 9.0g?
Glider at 40.0 m/s, mass 60.0 kg, loop seat force 350 N. Find loop radius.
Earth radius = 6370 km. Person weighs 600.0 N at north pole. What is weight at equator?
Mass m at end of cord swings at 40.0° from vertical. Find tension in cord at 20.0°.
